meanings.definition: The act of making something federal.
meanings.sent1: The federalizations of the education system improved its efficiency.
meanings.sent2: The federalizations of the healthcare system led to better access for all citizens.
meanings.sent3: The federalizations of the national parks made them more organized and accessible to visitors.
meanings.sent4: Her leadership brought about the federalizations of the company, streamlining its operations.
meanings.sent5: The federalizations of the transportation system reduced delays and improved safety.

meanings.definition: The process of organizing or structuring something according to federal principles.
meanings.sent1: The federalizations of the laws ensured consistency across all states.
meanings.sent2: The federalizations of the policies aimed to create a unified approach.
meanings.sent3: The federalizations of the office layout made it easier for employees to collaborate.
meanings.sent4: The team worked on the federalizations of the project to align it with regulations.
meanings.sent5: The federalizations of the budget process simplified financial management.

meanings.definition: The state of being under the control or authority of a federal government.
meanings.sent1: The federalizations of the territories brought them into the national fold.
meanings.sent2: The federalizations of the regions ensured uniformity in governance.
meanings.sent3: The federalizations of the city services improved overall efficiency.
meanings.sent4: The new law led to the federalizations of certain industries.
meanings.sent5: The federalizations of the regulations helped maintain order and standards.
